body.p: All the streams use the standard Data Refinery auditing interface, meaning that counters and throughput can be monitored at node level. The audit information captured for each specific node is detailed in the following sections. For more information on Data Refinery auditing, see Data Refinery Functional Description.

In the following tables, the Counter type column indicates the types of counters that are incremented by records coming into the node (left of the = sign) and by outgoing records (right of the = sign). Counter types available are:
RecordsIn
RecordsOut
Filtered
Rejected
ReprocessedIn
Created
Duplicated
Stored
Retrieved
ReducedInMerging
